intro: Alphitonia marquesensis, commonly known as the Marquesan Alphitonia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Moʻo in the French Polynesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Alphitonia marquesensis is a rare and endemic species, making it an important subject of botanical study due to its limited distribution and unique ecological role.
